history.content:
I'm another student very interested in being a MLE.

I have read many job listings online, which I highly recommend you do to understand job responsibilities better, and it seems like tl;dr MLEs bridge the gap b/w SWE and DS/ML people and thus have skills from both roles, but probably not in depth as either. As such, I think it'd be wise to take systems/SWE-relevant classes like 186 and 162 (which means you also need 61C) if you want to be more competitive for said roles, but like with most SWE-related roles, any particular class isn't strictly necessary.

I'm another student very interested in being a MLE.

I have read many job listings online, which I highly recommend you do to understand job responsibilities better, and it seems like tl;dr MLEs bridge the gap b/w SWE and DS/ML people and thus have skills from both roles, but probably not in depth as either. As such, I think it'd be wise to take systems/SWE-relevant classes like 186 and 162 (which means you also need 61C) if you want to be more competitive for said roles, but like with most SWE-related roles, any particular class isn't strictly necessary.

Does anyone have an idea on what is this role all about? Will a data science major accompanied with classes such as CS 186, CS 189, CS 182, CS 188 might equip us with necessary skills? Do we need classes like CS 61C and CS 162? 

Thank you. Any response will be appreciated.
history.subject: Machine Learning Engineer Role
